title: The complete works of Robert Burns:
author: Burns, Robert
snippet: He looked in at princely Taymouth ; mused an hour or two among th« Birks of Aberfeldy; gazed from Birnara top; paused amid the wild grandeur of the pass of Ealliecraukie, at the stone which marks the spot Avhere a second patriot Graham fell, and spent a day at Blair, where he experienced the graceful kindness — Ae Duke of Athol, and in a strain truly elegant, petitioned him, in the name of Bruar Water, to hide the utter nakedness of its otherwise picturesque banks, with plantations of birch and oak.
